abstract.text: Provides the pasteboard writer for the item at the specified index

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The collection view making the request.
The index of the item requiring a pasteboard writer.
The pasteboard writer object to use for managing the item data. Return
to prevent the collection view from dragging the item.

The collection view calls this method for each item involved in the drag operation after it has determined that a drag should begin but before the drag operation has started.  Your implementation of this method should create and return the pasteboard writer—an object conforming to the
protocol—to use for providing the item’s data. Using the object you provide, the collection view creates an
object for you and configures its
properties for you using information from the item at the specified index path.
If you implement this method, the collection view does not call the

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An ordered collection of data items displayed in a customizable layout.
This method computes and returns an image to use for dragging.
A set of methods that you use to manage the behavior of a collection view.
Invoked when the mouse is released over a collection view that previously allowed a drop.
Returns a Boolean indicating whether the collection view can begin dragging the specified items.
Creates and returns a drag image to represent the specified items during a drag.
Notifies your delegate that a drag session is about to begin.
Invoked to return an array of filenames that the receiver promises to create.
Provides the pasteboard writer for the item at the specified index
Validates the specified location to see if it is a valid drop target.
Invoked after it has been determined that a drag should begin, but before the drag has been started.
A single dragged item within a dragging session.
The frame of the dragging item.
An array of dragging image components to use to create the drag image.
A set of methods that defines the interface for retrieving a representation of an object that can be written to a pasteboard.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A signed integer value type.
